msg: Discussion of the Hyperledger Trade Finance Group
Discussion of the Hyperledger Trade Finance SIG
I wonder if the SIG members know about the existence of this channel.
Discussion of the Hyperledger Trade Finance SIG https://wiki.hyperledger.org/display/TFSIG
Is this more of a general purpose chat or is it focused more specifically on either dev-ops or business applications?

We are looking for Fabric Developers and training groups to help us design the next Fabric Developer Certification on July 8-11 at the LF offices in SF.  If you have Fabric experience please apply here. ttps://forms.gle/v4CuDnHQ9QA9pf6p8
I'm more interested in fabric development from a financial services point of view, but their doesn't seem to be a channel for that here...

Though I am interested in the dev cert program you referenced above. I'm just an analyst/architect. I am finding myself having to do more dev work for various teams at my firm due to the lack of knowledge with fabric.
How does one join this SIG?
I would start at the wiki page https://wiki.hyperledger.org/display/TFSIG @mpiekarska

We will be starting a new capital markets SIG with a broader scope, it will not be confined to just Fabric; but as fabric is a big part of the HL greenhouse this will be a fit topic for discussion. if interested please register at  https://wiki.hyperledger.org/display/HYP/Capital+Markets+SIG+Proposal
Can anyone join this thing, or do I need to be a member of something else first...?

Anyone can join, but to be on the mailing list or edit the wiki, you need a Linux Foundation ID. The site to register interest is  https://wiki.hyperledger.org/display/HYP/Capital+Markets+SIG+Proposal, please put your name under  "Interested Parties"
The LFID is free. No other membership needed.

Article one - for discussion:
Blockchain and IoT
https://www.gtreview.com/news/fintech/new-industry-consortium-to-launch-iot-driven-commodity-trade-finance-platform/
QUESTION;  Are you integrating, or thinking about integrating IoT into your trade finance projects?

Article two- for discussion:
Blockchain in Iran
https://cointelegraph.com/news/iran-developing-national-blockchain-platform-on-ibm-hyperledger-fabric
QUESTION;  This is one of a number of national-level trade finance platforms, do they distract from the international projects, or help?

Article three - for discussion:
https://www.gtreview.com/news/fintech/marco-polo-blockchain-project-on-track-following-new-live-pilot/.
QUESTION; MarcoPolo is described in the article as being very different from We-Trade.   What are the main differences?

Article four- for discussion:
Switzerland Crypto Currency
https://www.coindesk.com/think-tank-pushes-for-creation-of-a-national-cryptocurrency-in-switzerland. 
QUESTION; Are stable-coins necessary to make trade finance more efficient?

Article five - for discussion:
Digital Asset's change in stance;
https://www.ft.com/content/77bc7fd4-8903-11e9-97ea-05ac2431f453. 
QUESTION;  Has anyone experience of DAML?  How does it enhance Hyperledger?
Hi guys, Since Will is absent this week; I have volunteered to run the meeting. I will be asking for suggestions on the Agenda etc.

I had volunteered to run the meeting in Will's absence.
Notes are up at https://wiki.hyperledger.org/display/TFSIG/12+Nov+2019+-+Notes
All notes, tasks and recordings are also there!

Calling all Projects, SIG, and WG!!!  We will have a Video recording Studio setup at HGF (Hyperledger Global Forum). We are asking that all projects and groups help us create a 5 minute video about your group so that we can promote it afterward. Sign up Here! https://wiki.hyperledger.org/display/HGF/Video+Recording+Schedule

Hello everyone This is Atul Patel I am helping as Vice-Chair of Trade Finance SIG along with Andrea Frosinini  who is main chair. Look forward to your continuous support and hope you would join us in upcoming webinar planned on April 14th 330pm SG/HK time
Hi Atul great to have you on board, look forward to the next call on April 14th 330pm SG/HK time
Hi Julian and Atul, great to meet in this space as well!
